fields.name: Level-1 Assistant Coaching Swimming
fields.description:
This course is designed to introduce the knowledge, skills and practices for the safe, ethical and effective support of coaching sessions.

The coaches who conduct swimming lessons are fully qualified, dedicated and expert swim coaches to ensure your child will have a thoroughly enjoyable time learning and developing their swimming skills.

It is the combination of swim coaches and our world-class facilities which allow us to provide a swim lessons academy which is unrivalled.

Course Content

- The role of the assistant coach
- Physical literacy in swimming
- Competitive swimming skills
- Types of training used to develop swimmers
- How to deliver pre-planned coaching sessions
- How to carry out reflective practices of your coaching
fields.extra_details:
- Minimum age to attend this courses is 15 years old
- Active NVB Vetting/ Access NI (16 years +)
- Safeguarding Level 1

fields.name: Level-2 Coaching Swimming
fields.description:
This course builds on the knowledge, skills and practices developed at Level 1 and will introduce additional further principles surrounding sport science in relation to the aquatic environment.

The coaches who conduct swimming lessons are fully qualified, dedicated and expert swim coaches to ensure your child will have a thoroughly enjoyable time learning and developing their swimming skills.

It is the combination of swim coaches and our world-class facilities which allow us to provide a swim lessons academy which is unrivalled.

Course Content

- Roles and responsibilities of a Swimming Coach
- Scientific principles of competitive swimming
- Competitive swimming skills
- Types of training used to develop swimmers
- Planning, delivery and evaluation of a series of sessions
- Effective management in training and competition
- Communication skills within the swimming coaching environment
- Motivational techniques
- Developing swimming skills and competitive swimming strokes
- Evaluating swimmer progress
- Reflecting and evaluating on own performance
- Planning for professional development
- Prepare and deliver session plans and training cycles
- Be responsible for athletes and Level 1 Assistant Swimming Coaches
fields.extra_details:
- Minimum age to attend this course is 16 years old
- Candidates must hold Level 1 Assistant Swimming Coach qualification
- Active NVB Vetting/ Access NI
- Safeguarding Level 1

fields.name: Level-3 Coaching Swimming
fields.description:
The Level 3 Coaching qualification will ensure coaches have the skills to work with competitive and elite performers in line with Long Term Athlete Development (LTAD) across all elements of water based and land based training activities.

Attendees will also develop the skills to identify when athletes require additional input from support professionals and how to access this.

The coaches who conduct swimming lessons are fully qualified, dedicated and expert swim coaches to ensure your child will have a thoroughly enjoyable time learning and developing their swimming skills.

It is the combination of swim coaches and our world-class facilities which allow us to provide a swim lessons academy which is unrivalled.

Course Content

- Planning, preparing and delivering long-term coaching plans
- Evaluating effectiveness plans in practice
- Managing a coaching programme
- How to lead a team of Level 1 Assistant Coaches and Level 2 Coaches
  developing and adapting coaching style to implement effective coaching practices
- Implementing elements of nutrition, psychology, strength and conditioning, biomechanics and 
  physiology into long-term plans within a club environment
fields.extra_details:
- Minimum age to attend this course is 18 years old
- Candidates must hold Level 2 Coaching qualification
- Active NVB Vetting/ Access NI
- Safeguarding Level 1

fields.name: Level 1 Assistant Swimming Teacher
fields.description:
This course develops your knowledge, skills and abilities as an assistant swimming teacher. It will enable you to actively support a qualified swimming teacher in the delivery of a planned learn to swim session.

The coaches who conduct swimming lessons are fully qualified, dedicated and expert swim coaches to ensure your child will have a thoroughly enjoyable time learning and developing their swimming skills.

It is the combination of swim coaches and our world-class facilities which allow us to provide a swim lessons academy which is unrivalled.

Course Content

- The responsibilities of a Swimming Assistant
- Working under the supervision of a qualified Level 2 Swimming Teacher
- The swimming pathway, fundamental movement, core aquatic skills and component parts of strokes
- Scientific principles of swimming
- What makes up a lesson plan, equipment and communications skills
- How to identify anxiety and use of motivational techniques
- Providing assistance in and out of the water
fields.extra_details:
- Minimum age to attend this course is 15 years old
- Active NVB Vetting/ Access NI (16 years +)
- Safeguarding Level 1

fields.name: Level 2 Swimming Teacher
fields.description:
This course develops your knowledge, skills and abilities as a Swimming Teacher. It builds on the Level 1 Assistant Swimming Teacher qualification and gives you the skills to independently deliver swimming lessons.

The coaches who conduct swimming lessons are fully qualified, dedicated and expert swim coaches to ensure your child will have a thoroughly enjoyable time learning and developing their swimming skills.

It is the combination of swim coaches and our world-class facilities which allow us to provide a swim lessons academy which is unrivalled.

Course Content

- The responsibilities and role of a swimming teacher
- How the scientific principles of swimming impact on development
- How to develop core aquatic skills and the four strokes
- How to identify and correct common swimming faults
- How to use a variety of teaching techniques and equipment to suit different needs
- How to plan and deliver inclusive lessons for different levels of ability. Includes adaptations for - 
   swimmers with special educational needs and disabilities.
- Key teaching and management skills including class management and assessment, organisational 
  skills, behaviour management, communication skills, and teaching methods
fields.extra_details:
- Minimum age to attend this course is 16 years
- Candidates must hold a Level 1 Assistant Swimming Teacher qualification
- Active NVB Vetting/ Access NI (16 years +)
- Safeguarding Level 1

fields.name: Level 2 Babies and Toddlers Swimming Teacher
fields.friendly_name: Level 2 Babies and Toddlers Swimming Teacher
fields.description:
This course develops your knowledge, skills and abilities as a swimming teacher for babies and toddlers/pre-school children.

It builds on the Level 2 Swimming Teacher qualification and gives you the skills to independently plan and deliver a series of baby and toddler swimming lessons.

The coaches who conduct swimming lessons are fully qualified, dedicated and expert swim coaches to ensure your child will have a thoroughly enjoyable time learning and developing their swimming skills.

It is the combination of swim coaches and our world-class facilities which allow us to provide a swim lessons academy which is unrivalled.

Course Content

- How early years development, stages of play and reflexes impact on swimming ability
- How to introduce and teach the core aquatic skills in a fun way
- The different supports and holds to use in lessons
- The advantages and disadvantages of different types of equipment
- How to plan, adapt and teach lessons which cater for groups with different levels of ability
- Key teaching and lesson management skills
fields.extra_details:
- Minimum age to attend this course is 18 years
- Candidates must hold Level 2 Swimming Teacher qualification
- Active NVB Vetting/ Access NI (16 years +)
- Safeguarding Level 1

fields.name: Aqua Skills
fields.description:
Our Learn to Swim programme will empower and inspire children to challenge themselves on their own personal journey of learning to swim.

The curriculum encompasses a range of teaching methodologies with a real focus on repetitive, accurate and quality practice with elements of guided discovery.

The program is delivered through structured play, ensuring the lessons are well planned with clear learning outcomes whilst engaging children in fun and relevant activities.

The coaches who conduct the swimming lessons are fully qualified, dedicated and expert swim coaches to ensure your child will have a thoroughly enjoyable time learning and developing their swimming skills.

It is the combination of swim coaches and our world-class facilities which allow us to provide a swim lessons academy which is unrivalled.
fields.extra_details: In Aqua Skills , Core Aquatic Skills are introduced, reinforced and consolidated, whilst developing water confidence. These skills are made up of Entries and Exits, Submersion and Aquatic Breathing, Rotation, Floatation, Streamlining, Sculling, Movement and Propulsion and Co-ordination and Balance, and will lay the foundation for the development of stroke technique.

fields.name: Learn to Swim Program!
fields.description:
The Learn to Swim program is designed to empower and inspire children to challenge themselves during their personal journey of learning to swim. Through these lessons, your child will gain well-planned lessons and repetitive, accurate and quality practice with elements of guided discovery. The Learn to Swim program is built on structured play, which allows children to become confident in their swimming while being a lot of fun!

The coaches who conduct the swimming lessons are fully qualified, dedicated and expert swim coaches to ensure your child will have a thoroughly enjoyable time learning and developing their swimming skills.

It is the combination of swim coaches and our world-class facilities which allow us to provide a swim lessons academy which is unrivalled.
fields.extra_details: Please be advised that our swim lessons are in high demand, and there may be a waiting list. Alternatively, you can travel to our dolphin academy which has capacity.

fields.name: Confident Swimmer Program
fields.description:
The swim lessons are held in a 10-lane 50-metre x 25-metre international-standard swimming pool with two moveable floors which allow our coaches to cater for all ability levels during our swimming lessons. 
When you have mastered the basics, you will join the advanced class to put all the skills you have learnt together. This will get you ready to swim on your own to keep fit or join a Triathlon Group â€“ 40 min class.
There is also a 25-metre international standard diving/warm-up pool to meet the needs of those in swimming lessons.
Swim 60 metres freestyle, demonstrating good rhythm and breathing.
Swim 60 metres backstroke, demonstrating good rhythm and breathing
Swim 40 metres breaststroke attempting to pull out and regular breathing.
Swim 10 metres using a butterfly action.
Using a kickboard kick 4 x 20 metres freestyle and backstroke.
Pull 20 metres freestyle using a pull buoy.
Using a pull buoy, scull 15 metres on FRONT and BACK, HEAD FIRST and FEET FIRST.
fields.extra_details:
Demonstrate a good push and glide on front and back; hold and kick underwater for 5 metres.
Swim 80 metres using 2 different strokes, holding good technique and turns without stopping.
